site_name: Texas Tech School of Veterinary Medicine

citations.narrative:
In Main Campus holding room W132, there are three separate primary enclosures housing one adult male cat (#10098),
one adult female cat (#100985) and one adult female cat and two kittens (ID numbers 100995, 100996, 100997) which do
not have elevated resting surfaces.
Lack of elevated resting surfaces can negatively impact the well-being of the animals, as such surfaces allow the animals
to exhibit natural behaviors and decrease stress. The registrant must ensure that each primary enclosure housing cats
has an elevated resting surface or surfaces that are impervious to moisture, easily cleaned, sanitized, or replaced when
soiled or worn, and large enough to comfortably hold all the occupants of the primary enclosure at the same time.
CORRECTED AT THE TIME OF INSPECTION ON AUGUST 31, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n
